module.title: anthroponymic namifications
module.p: Anthroponymic namifications are namifications which are also anthroponyms, i.e. they are definite common noun phrases used to name people (and other personified entities like toys, boats, houses, pet animals, &c).

ul.li: topoanthroponyms (the common noun is a demonym) – am Moireach the Duke of Atholl, am Muileach Hector MacLachlain, the Man from Mull
military ranks – an Caiptean the Captain, an Còirneal the Colonel

topoanthroponyms – Fear Canaidh John Lorne Campbell of Canna, Fear Chìosmuil MacNeil of Barra, Morair Ghalaibh the Earl of Caithness, Siosalach Shrathghlais Chisholm of Chisholm, Triath Dhubhairt MacLean of Duart
gamonyms (anthropoanthroponyms) – Bean Alasdair Alexander’s wife, banntrach Uilleim William’s widow

patronyms (anthropoanthroponyms) – Mac Cailein Mòr the Duke of Argyll, Mac Chailein Mhic Dhonnachaidh the Earl of Breadalbane, Mac Dhòmhnaill Dhuibh Cameron of Lochiel, Mac Gille Chaluim MacLeod of Raasay, Mac Iain MacDonald of Glencoe, Mac Mhic Ailein MacDonald of Clanranald, Mac Mhic Alasdair MacDonald of Glengarry, MacShimidh Lord Lovat (Fraser),
